result.execSummary:
The defendant Alex J. Marcussen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, 2nd/Sub. Drug Off.-Class E/F/G/H/I Fel.], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Manuf/Deliver Designer Drugs (<=3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, 2nd/Sub. Drug Off.-Class E/F/G/H/I Fel.], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(hm)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes: Pay $250 fine plus costs on each count of the action. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  No contact direct or indirect with JD. Not to go to skate park if there's anyone else there. Not to enter into bars or taverns unless for employment.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Submit DNA sample.
Obtain AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

timeConds.notes: 3 months of sentence are stayed to be used at discretion of Court through petition by Dept. of Corrections. Huber privileges granted. 60 days to report.

Defendant Alex J. Marcussen in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters guilty pleas to Counts 2, 3. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 2, 3. Counts 1, 4 are dismissed but read in for sentencing. Court reviews concept of PTAC.  Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.
Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas. Status conference set for May 2, 2016 at 3:30.
by State
